Reviews.Title: “This hotel is value for money and has an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: WauSingapore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very satisfied with Vagabond Inn with its cleanliness and excellent location to downtown LA & USC. The room we had was on the second floor, which was a little further from the street. This was good because we could hear the sirens very often, though not loudly. If it were a room near the street, I could imagine it could get quite noisy. We especially want to thank Jasmine and Nazneen who were extremely helpful with tips and directions to various sights and attractions in LA. Bravo! Jasmine and Nazneen! However, the same thing cannot be said about Samantha, who said she was not from LA and was new on the job. Whenever we approached her for help, she never made an effort to help us, not even by searching the Internet or asking somebody else who might have the information. To be fair we didn't expect her to know everything, neither did Jasmine nor Nazneen, but Samantha just wasn't helpful at all. It was very frustrating for us because we were very new to LA, having flown almost 19 hours from Singapore. Anyway, our experience and impression were not marred by her. We just want to thank Vagabond Inn and the people we met for a wonderful experience in LA. Reviewed by S.F. Chin - Singapore 18 March 2012

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper and with clerks volunteering information & negotiating for customers' interests”
Reviews.Author: tsai m
Reviews.Content: In my second day in the frontdesk, I overheard a clerk told the other traveler that vagabondinn can arrange shuttle bus for customers travelling from the inn to LAX airport at the cost of US16 (for the bus trip). I felt assured to get that information. When I was assisted to place a call to arrange the shuttle bus one day upon my checkout, I was quoted with a fee of US18 + tips (about 2.00), so I asked the clerk on duty that day (Nazneen) for clarification. The 18+2 price was new to Nazneen too, so she took over and talk to the bus call center. I was very imprssed that Nazneen negotiated for my interest (or of all residents at vagabondinn) with very solid and presuasive reasons, although my original intention was to clarify rather than negotiate. As a non-native travellers in USA, I really appreciate that vagabondinn has clerks who are willing to volunteer important information and negotiate for their cumstomers' interest and can handle things nicely. The only thing I'm not used to is this: to get your breakfast you need to travel from your room to another building where the front desk is located. (but I guess that's the arrangement it has to be).

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay USC, this is it. It is just across the street sandwiched between two private student housing complexes. This used to be in a sketchy neighborhood, and "under construction buildings" but that has been changed as of Fall 2011. If you have a child living in University Gateway, it is great for visiting on many levels. We have stayed at many nice hotels downtown but you can beat this location. There is nothing fancy but it works, price is great and the rooms are functional and clean. Free internet, free parking and 10th night is free. Great deal

Reviews.Title: “Fine for teenage boys”
Reviews.Author: heidiwm
Reviews.Content: The name says it all. This is a tough one. It's clean but it's old. You don't want to drop any belongings on the floor here. Employees are very friendly and location to USC is great. You can handle this for 1 night. When Radisson is sold out this is the only place within walking distance to USC. I would consider sleeping on my kids dorm room floor next time. Really.

Reviews.Title: “This is the BEST bang for your buck around USC”
Reviews.Author: EAPDallas
Reviews.Content: We came for the USC-UCLA game. We booked the Vagabond in September. The price and location cannot be beat. It is HANDS DOWN superior to the nasty Radisson down the street. It is literally a block off the northern most part of campus. You can park for free and walk to the game. We stayed here last year. The place looked cleaner this year. The rooms are just basic with reasonable furniture and a fairly comfortable bed. NO BUGS. NO SMELLS. The bathroom is also quite basic but there was plenty of hot water. No exhaust vent in the shower area so things get a little steamy. Keep the window open. AC works well. The folks at the front desk were very nice to us. We used the printer to get boarding passes. Coffee in the am was decent. There was some major rave party going on about a block away one evening that literally shook the floors and the walls. This is beyond their control and had nothing to do with the hotel. It was hard to believe that LA allows permits for 40,000 random partiers. But hey, it's LA. Tip: bring ear plugs, then you won't care about any noise. Overall, you should use common sense when running around at night in the area. The hotel does have security (who were quite visible) and security cameras. Tip: Ask for extra towels when you get there because they are a tad small. And with all that steam, you need more drying power. We will be staying here again for sure. The great change over the last year is that the University Gateway apartment complex is now complete and features many decent fast food restaurants and a CVS within a minute walk from the hotel. Things are definitely improving around the whole area. You cannot beat this hotel for a game weekend or any other USC event. It is not posh but it's so worth it not to waste time in the car trying to get to campus from downtown LA (not to mention waiting to get your car out of valet at say, the Biltmore), And you don't have to pay to park on campus which saves time and lots of money on game days.

Reviews.Title: “Not a rave review”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl59
Reviews.Content: This Vagabond Inn has one overwhelming asset--it is next to USC and one of only two hotels in the area. This made it our choice for Parents Weekend.What we did not know--and the manager claimed ignorance as well--was that a "rave" was planned at a venue a block away, on two nights of our stay. Outdoors. Incredibly loud, shaking the building. Until 2 a.m. The solution offered by the management was that we could move to another hotel and they would refund those two nights' stay. Oh, right--pack up all our stuff and find another hotel at the last minute, on a busy weekend in LA and miles away from the university and the festivities we were there to attend. We stayed, put on earphones and gritted our teeth. Oh, gosh, almost forgot, they dropped off several sets of earplugs while we were out. On top of that they charged a premium for it being Parents Weekend and supplied as few towels as possible. And there were bugs in the bathrooom. If you can get a really low price or must be near USC, go for it; I will be searching for alternatives next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean Convenient Budget Motel Close to Downtown and USC”
Reviews.Author: Thomas M
Reviews.Content: This is a budget motel--do not expect turn down service, a concierge, free breakfasts, room service, bell boys, or chocolates on your pillow each night. However, you can expect to have a good, clean room, free parking, a nice TV, refridgerator, microwave, in room coffee, a great air conditioner, wireless internet, minimal customer service, and a swimming pool for hot days. It is close to USC and downtown. All for about 1/2 the price as hotels within a half mile. You are walking distance to USC and a 25 cent Dash Bush ride to downtown, about 5 minutes away. For business travelers, there are nearby copy services, several banks, UPS, and computer stores all within a short walk. For tourists, LA Live (with clubs, concerts, and high end restaurants) is a Dash Bus away, but stops early evening, so it would be a cab ride home, or a mile walk. If you are into dive bars, the 901 bar is across the street, which is a fun time. Dry cleaners are a short walk, A laundromat is about a half mile away on Jefferson. The motel does not have a breakfast restaurant within the compound, but you are an easy walk to 5-10 inexpensive restaurants on Figureroa. Most rooms in this area will run you $225-300. Rooms at the Vagabond will run you about $100 with typical discount cards. Perfect if you can forgo hand-holding, free breakfasts, and chocolate mints on your pillow. If you need that extra special service and hand-holding, then hit the JW Marriot at $299 a night for the cheap rooms. It's about a mile up the road near LA Live. Kobe Bryant stays there during home games.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: KoKonutGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time 2 years ago in August 2009 when I took my daughter to school at USC. Stayed again in August 2011 for the same reason. It's very convenient and the only closer place is the Radisson. The coniinental breakfast is a nice perk but I've never seen yogurt as another reviewer mentioned. Mostly donuts but the bagels and cream cheese is nice plus the apples and oranges. On the downside, I checked in on a Sunday after 5pm and they were going to charge me $20 late check-in fee because check-in is at 2pm. WTH? Also when I went to turn on the A/C about 8:30p that night, I couldn't find the remote so I decided to turn it on manually by climbing onto the bathroom sink. Well, it didn't work that way either. I called the front desk and he said maintenance went home but they could check it in the AM. I think they knew it wasn't working so they decided to remove the remote. The room also had a very antiseptic smell to it. The only other good thing is the free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to USC”
Reviews.Author: longandshortofit
Reviews.Content: With a child now attending USC, we will stay here again for the convenience. It is a short walk to campus. Great value for downtown with free parking and wifi. The neighborhood is not great but we were never worried; just use common sense. Our room was a decent size with a fridge and microwave. But the hotel is a bit shabby and worn and could really use a renovation. The free breakfast has little in the way of variety and quantity. If you go late you may go hungry! On our last visit they had yogurt but not this time; we missed it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!!!”
Reviews.Author: parachutemusic
Reviews.Content: Located very close to the USC campus as well as downtown Los Angeles. The staff was very helpful when they switched our one king-sized bed room for another room with two beds. No doubt that I'm coming back here the next time I visit USC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room service”
Reviews.Author: drizzle1111
Reviews.Content: The house keeper's supervisor Maria was very tending, very helpful and caring to both me and my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid. The service is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: stmsfo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here May 26 to May 30 (Memorial Day) 2011. I was here with my niece who is considering attending USC. This motel is value priced, and very close to campus. However, the service (as in the front desk) is absolutely terrible. They have a bad attitude, give minimal information, and don't have any real concern for the guests. The wi-fi connection was spotty, and frequently didn't work. In addition, Sunday evening May 29, starting about 8:00 PM, they simply locked the front office and left. Didn't even answer the internal house phone! When I pointed this out to the front desk clerk on Monday morning, he said that "wasn't usual" but had nothing else to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized family rooms, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: lisaq42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vagabond Inn Los Angeles/USC for three nights with two other friends. We needed a place that had 3 beds in a room and was close to Hollywood and Downtown LA and this hotel fit the bill. The family room had a king bed in the main room and two twin beds in the little annex room- each room had a tv and dresser. It also came with a mini-fridge and microwave. The bathroom was clean and the room was decorated nicely. The air conditioning took a while to cool the rooms down but once it got going it was fine. The rate for this room was about $115 a night and parking was free, so between 3 people it was a good deal. The grounds aren't anything special, but there was a pool on site. There are lots of little restaurants within walking distance and access to the 110 freeway is very close. The hotel was extremely quiet at night and the beds were comfortable. I am not sure if the hotel had free wi-fi but we were able to use the USC wi-fi signal since it was unlocked. There were some guests that had their room doors open and were partying and some guys drinking in the back of a truck in the parkinglot but we ignored them. That was a little weird though. Also when we checked out, I was simply handed a receipt by the desk clerk, before I had a chance to ask her to please split it between my roommates and I. She gave a bit of attitude when I asked her to split it. She said I should have asked first. My reply was that usually a clerk asks how a guest would like to pay before putting a charge though! She reversed it and split it on 2 cards. Next time, she should ask the guest first. Except for those two things, the hotel itself was just fine: clean, comfortable, and in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and construction work right outside room”
Reviews.Author: c0harb01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and came home with bites all over my arms, hands, feet, neck, chin, and back. Went to a dermatologist and he informed me that these lesions were caused by bed bugs. Called the manager to inform him of this and he was very rude, raised his voice, and basically yelled at me when I informed him I would be writing a review about this. He was very unprofessional and did not know how to handle this situation and continued arguing with me. After calling Orbitz, they took care of the situation respectfully and professionally without raising their voices. On top of that, there was construction work being done right outside my window the whole time I was there. WOULD NOT STAY THERE AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hagop
Reviews.Content: We were only in LA for a day and would spend most of that time out and about, so we didn't want to spend too much for a place we really only needed to sleep in. All we needed was a clean room with comfortable beds that was relatively quiet, maybe grab a quick breakfast before heading out. We didn't get any of that. The room was extremely dated and smelled musty. The beds/pillows were so uncomfortable that we tossed and turned most of the night. The loud people outside probably didn't help in that respect either. In the morning, we went to the lobby to have breakfast. Well, we TRIED to have breakfast, but this homeless junkie came in and started talking incoherently about Osama bin Laden and kept trying to talk to my grandmother, who was freaking out at this point. He kept us asking us for our food and coffee, and by this point we were a little unnerved by his behavior, so we just gave him our food and left. Oh, and the clerk was too busy playing internet games and listening to her iPod to intervene. Great service. Btw, this hotel was not cheap. We paid about $120 for that wonderful experience. Next time I'd rather pitch in more and get a good night's rest and avoid being harrassed by the bums.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: zoom2anil
Reviews.Content: Good place. Small rooms through. Location-wise it is very good. 10min driving distance from the convention center and Staples center in downtown LA. Amenities were good. Free wi-fi internet.

Reviews.Title: “What a great value!”
Reviews.Author: RBeltee
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to downtown LA. Tons of places to eat and right next to USC campus. Fast check in with friendly and efficient front desk person.Had a quiet night's rest. The only bad thing - they ran out of bagels at the continental breakfast and I had to settle for a donut.

Reviews.Title: “Need to check for noise maintenance employee”
Reviews.Author: Circa99
Reviews.Content: I'm on vacation with my girlfrind. Ignorant guests come and are booked to the right and left of us. Seems like mr employee at the front books all look alike bad gusts in one crner and Anglo white I. The quiet closes to office and nice rooms. We are stuck between some cadillacs and impala with loud bumping music. I called employee to call them to do something about th noise and said he would and waited for him to no avail. Employee cares more about resting his eyes. Ridculous I called at 11:00 sharp and it's 1:30 am and I'm writing a review just shows how obnoxious these ppl are. I think this employee pinpinted as ppl who would be obnoxious but we were just here to takae vaction. I know how hotels work based o. Someone appearance they give you q certain room and rate occasionally. I k ow this for fact brother use to work for 25 hrs at different hotels big n small. You know I'm really wait g for th manager to reply because I am disaapoited. 190 for 2 nites to have some obnoxious loud music on Saturday ridiculous. Will not recommend it to anyone for now. I hope to get a phone number I can rach th manage directly seriuolsy So one last thing I forgot to mention so I went to the front on Friday to the desk n ask for a do not interrupt. N couldn't find one but the grossest thing o saw was a rat outside the door running literally by fron desk. Why did I stay here?stay tired of driving n girlfrind wanted to sleep. It's 2:00 am n still partin will not comback till I hear a response from manager n will not recomend ruined the nite. Will make a post on LA county consumer affairs also. For the r ord employee did not want to give us another rooom n did not do anything about loud guests pathetic sevice

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: AussieGreg4000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel a lot, This trip to the USA from Australia, In LA we stayed here, We could not fault our stay, none of the bad thing people wrote we witnessed, It is clean, very safe, and according to the Police, its the safest part of LA!, close to lots of things, the Fashion district is not far, it has a huge market, great value. buses at the door every 3mins cost 50 cents, this is a good place to stay, staff go out of their way to help. Allowing for the culture differences, NO WORRIES!, when in LA next, we we be back, Greg from OZ.

Reviews.Title: “Close to USC only, nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: vita614
Reviews.Content: The only reason why I stayed at this hotel was due to its proximity to USC. There is another hotel that's closer, but that one is double the price. The staff can only handle basic check-in and check-out job. Service is poor. I recently used their 10th night free promotion for the 1st night of my 4-night stay. When I checked-in, I told the front desk person specifically that I've reserved the other 3 nights with a different agency, so please make sure that the room he would assign me to is one that I can stay for all 4 nights without changing rooms. He said that it was done and I can stay in the same room for all 4 nights, but I would have to come back the next morning just to check-in again. So, I did that the next morning, only to be told by the morning front desk person that I have to switch rooms!!! She kept saying that this is not the other staff's fault (implying that it was mine) and her attitude was bad. At the end, she did let me stay in the same room, but it was as if she had done me a big favor. If the night front desk staff had done his job to check me in properly, there would have been no issues. Very bad customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy bedding let down this budget motel”
Reviews.Author: hertswoman
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay close to the Sports Arena for one night for a Bruce Springsteen concert. This is a budget hotel in a poor downtown neighbourhood so I wasn't expecting much. The front desk staff were pleasant enough and the motel grounds seemed well maintained. My room was pretty dingy but generally clean. The bathroom looked quite new and was a pleasant surprise. However, when I pulled back the bedspread soiled pillows where visible through the pillow cases and I slept with a towel over them. The skimpy sheet revealed a stained mattress which was pretty revolting. Despite being close to a busy road it was quite quiet at night and once I'd locked the door I didn't feel particularly unsafe. Bruce was great but I don't think I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Spiffydude
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to LA and I booked a stay at this hotel. I must say I was pleasantly surprised.. It is one of the cheapest accommodation I could find in the area, but yet it had the amenities and facilities of any other regular hotel. The room was neat and large enough for two. TV had 99 channels so no lack of entertainment.. The staff were friendly, and although I arrived early, the front desk staff was very helpful and accommodated to me checking in early (at 11am as opposed to the stated time of 2pm). Free parking is a convenience to all those who drive. The restaurant staff were also very friendly. Breakfast was included in the booking, and although it was simple fare, it was adequate to start the day. The only gripe I had was the internet connection wasn't working throughout my stay. Reason was that the provider didn't come down to service it. It was mitigated somewhat by the availability of a stand alone in the front desk, as well as wireless connection at the restaurant, but still it caused some inconvenience as the restaurant is not open 24/7 and there is only ONE available terminal to be shared by all tenants. This is the only reason why I wouldn't rate it a 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, OK location”
Reviews.Author: Chavodel8
Reviews.Content: Very good value. Appreciate the fast internet connection. Standard motel-type accommodations, but it seems like they do an especially good job, esp. considering the price. Rooms are quiet despite the busy street. Location is good - hop on the free and frequent DASH bus to downtown in 10-15 min total.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pyt06
Reviews.Content: After Having a Pleasant stay at the vagabond SFO I decided to try this Vagabond Inn on Figueroa while on trip with a few friends. The exterior and curb appeal was nice with palm trees and well kept grass and flowers. Check in was fast and easy the front desk attendant was very helpful and informed me with all the amenities. We had a family suite on the second floor that consisted of a large room with a king bed and a smaller room with bunk beds. Both rooms had a TV and shared a bathroom. The room was clean had all the basic necessities along with working ac. There was no Wi-Fi but they did have DSL and were generous enough to lend me an Ethernet cable. The hotel seemed high on occupancy, the pool was somewhat crowded but we had no parking problems. The vicinity was great everything seemed to be with in walking distance and open 24 hours we did not feel threatened at all by the neighborhood. The location was perfect for our needs. On Saturday night we had the front desk call a taxi to take us into Hollywood and it was there within 10 minutes and only cost us $30 one way (in SF that would have been a good $50 trip). Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I am content with my decision of having stayed there and will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Inn”
Reviews.Author: JiVi
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a weekday, early in the afternoon. The front desk staff were cordial and helpful. We were two adults and two children under 4. When we arrived, our room was not ready. A senior staff member offered to let us wait in the pool area under some shade. The room was clean. The furniture is relatively old but in good condition. There were ants in the "kitchen area" - where the sink, fridge, and microwave were, but the management is taking care of it--the fumigator was there during our stay. At night, the neighbourhood is generally quiet. The continental breakfast begins at 6:30 a.m., which is great for those of us who are early birds. We were able to get to the Convention Centre by bus - the Dash for only 25 cents per person. The Dash and other bus services are available within a block from the Inn. There are lots of eating places in the vicinity - McDonalds, Subway, Mexican food, etc. If we visited LA again and needed to be close to Downtown, I would definitely stay at this Inn. I recommend it for any traveller who wants to be close to Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Better places for the same price”
Reviews.Author: elislup
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with some friends, the trip wasn't planned so as soon as we got in L.A. we booked the first place we heard of, here are some good and bad things: The good: Comfortable beds and pillows Air conditioner Coffee maker, instant coffee, hair dryer Nice bathroom Friendly cleanning staff Decent breakfast The bad: The price was a bit expensive, i searched other hotels for the same price and they were better. The front desk people a bit rude Not a safe neighborhood Noisy air conditioner Ants all over the place even in the bed

Reviews.Title: “Served Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Soonerfan52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending an event at USC and for the most part were not dissappointed. It's what we expected based on other reviewers' comments. The front desk help, while not bouncing-off-the-walls elated that we chose to stay here, was efficient and professional enough. Our room was clean, the bed was comfortable and everything was in working order. It was nice to have a refrigerator and microwave in the room and to park (for free) just outside our room. Only negatives - we did request an extra pillow but was told none were available (which is plausible considering what appeared to be high occupancy). Also, don't let the "free continental breakfast" be a selling factor. It's less than basic; one or two types of pastries, some coffee and that's it. The surrounding area is a mix of college-oriented businesses, some commercial ventures and several fast food restaurants. We walked the two blocks from the Vagabond to USC several times at night and never felt threatened although caution and common sense should always be exercised. Unless their rates become too out of line with what you get, we'll most likely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: Europe02
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here prior to her job at one of the museums before she moved to a USC campus apt. The hotel is walking distance to USC as well as University Village. The check in clerk was efficient, no-nonsense. The rooms are clean, but the carpets were old. If you have a lot of bags, try to get a ground floor room because there is no elevator and you have to lug everything upstairs. The first night we were here the hotel was full of kids going to a ball game so it was kinda noisy, but that was okay with us. There was a homeless man with a bicycle next to our room and the manager/security persons told him to leave. The diner on premises gave bad service, but perhaps it was a bad day for the girl. LAPD (Police) eat there every morning & we found that to be reassuring. The grounds have pretty flowers with a pool next to the parking lot. But the overall cleanliness on the ousdie fo the hotel needs work. All in all, an okay place for the $ if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms smelled, toilets ran all night, everyone at the front desk was completly and overly rude on purpose. I asked for a smoking room and the guy at the front desk said the whole hotel was non-smoking, The man behind me asked for the same....and GOT IT! This hotel is geared more toward the spanish speaking. They called at 9 am and reminded me that check out was at 11 am, they then proceded to tell me that I had to get out as soon as possible so the maid could clean the room by 11 for the next guest. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Heart of LA!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a Univerisity Professor. My collegue and I came to LA to do some research at USC. I stayed at the Vagabond Inn because our reservation at the Radisson was not found when we arrived. I was pleasantly surprised, when I entered the room, as I am not familiar with this name. The room was clean, and looked to have been renovated recently. The most exciting part, is that they were filming a movie on the premises. As a theatre-buff, I was excited to see this! I would recommmend The Vagabond Inn to any of my collegues travelling to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mamastrauss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (my husband and I and 2 kids in one room; my mom and my sister in another room) while my husband attended a conference at the convention center and the rest of us went sight-seeing. The location here worked great, and this motel met our needs much better than the big, fancy downtown hotel we stayed in last year. The rooms were larger, the parking was free, the kids loved the pool (warm and no one else used it much, but not the cleanest), and the breakfast was quite good--decent bagels, and a variety of other options, including excellent croissants, donuts, and sticky buns (not all available every day). Also juices, coffee, hot cocoa mix, etc. At the desk, a sign advertised free wireless in some rooms, and the person at the desk said that it was available in every room, but we couldn't get it to work in our room. Then they said it wasn't available in every room. My techie husband got a cord to connect to a land line in the room, but this probably wouldn't work for everyone. My mom and sister's room had an ant invasion and an odd smell -- the management responded quickly to the ants. In our room, we could hear our neighbor's TV through the connecting door, and they could probably hear our kids. We had requested that our two rooms have a connecting door, but they weren't able to put us in adjacent rooms. In sum, this is an average, budget motel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A massive nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I own my own company and had brought my staff and myself to LA for a convention down town. We really only used the hotel to sleep at. We had to endure night after night noise of beligerent drunk people and children who were staying in the other rooms. I wasn't even able to use the pool because I felt unsafe about the neighborhood, and the other guests at the hotel. Things were stolen out of our room, probably by housekeeping. Upon check out they accused us of stealing a cable box from the room. We were accused of being the ones who made all the noise, and told that we would be charged for things that were never even in our room to begin with. When we refused to pay the large amount of money they claimed was the cost of the items, the manager became violent, threatened to call the police and charged our credit card anyway. I have never been treated like this by a hotel staff, and am considered a valued guest at other hotels. The experience was so bad, I am now pressing charges against the hotel for fraud and harrasment . If you stay here, be prapared to loose sleep, be accused of crimes , lose valuable items that belong to you, and make sure to bring your lawyer.

Reviews.Title: “First try for this hotel--happy with stay.”
Reviews.Author: julie5000
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here visiting the University of Southern California (just down the street) based on a trip advisor review. Everything in the review was accurate. The hotel was not much to look at from the outside, but the rooms were clean, decently furnished, and a decent size. The beds were very comfortable, too. There was an Internet terminal in the office available for guests' use. I had no safety problems walking to and from the University during the day. Also, it was pleasant to jog around Exposition Park and the museums (across the street from USC) in the morning. I did not see many other joggers in the morning, but a lot of people seem to jog there after work. Given the rate I got, $85, I felt like it was a bargain for visiting USC, along with other downtown sights--Museum of Natural History, China Town, Olvera Street, the fashion district, etc.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have a son at USC and have become frequent travelers to LA. We have stayed here, at the Radisson, and the Wilshire Grand as well. This is a budget hotel, motor court style, with decent beds. Fine Coffee shop, The Grinder, at the front. LAPD eats there alot and it is kinda nice having the police cars parked out front. Minimal continental breakfast offered- rolls, bagels, coffee, sunny delight.. You can walk to lots of other inexpensive resaturants both chain and locally run. Pool in the center adds a bit of charm. You are in the big city and will see street people that won't hassle you. It is a quick walk to USC. Football fans stay there on game days. There is such a lack of hotels near to USC that if you want to stay close to USC and the Radisson is full, you can at least have more money in your pocket for other fun things if you stay here. The desk help was professional. There is a computer terminal in the office, which is handy. Parking is free- a LA rarity.
